@graph.name: Dr. Ariel Desjardins-Charbonneau

alumniOf.name: Université de Montréal
alumniOf.description: Université de Montréal is a public research university in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Founded in 1878, it offers a wide range of programs including Physical Therapy. The university is known for its strong emphasis on research and innovation in healthcare sciences.

hasCredential.name: Fellow of the Canadian Academy of Manipulative Physiotherapy (FCAMPT)

recognizedBy.name: Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec (OPPQ)

@graph.description: Dr. Ariel Desjardins-Charbonneau is a highly experienced physiotherapist with a strong background in research, teaching, and clinical practice. As a Fellow of the Canadian Academy of Manipulative Physiotherapy (FCAMPT) and co-owner of Physioactif, Dr. Desjardins-Charbonneau combines deep expertise in manual therapy with a passion for education and patient care.
@graph.disambiguatingDescription: Dr. Ariel Desjardins-Charbonneau's career spans clinical practice, research, and education. Starting as a physical therapist at Physioactif in 2012, he quickly expanded their role to include lecturing at the University of Montréal and conducting research at Hopital Maisonneuve-Rosemont. In 2018, he became co-owner and co-CEO of Physioactif, while continuing to contribute to the field through speaking engagements and teaching at Physiolab School.

image.name: Dr. Ariel Desjardins-Charbonneau
image.description: Dr. Ariel Desjardins-Charbonneau is a professional service provider specializing in physiotherapy and manual therapy.
image.text: Dr. Ariel Desjardins-Charbonneau offers expert physiotherapy services tailored to meet individual patient needs.
image.disambiguatingDescription: Dr. Ariel Desjardins-Charbonneau is a physiotherapy expert with years of experience in clinical practice, research, and education.
image.keywords: physiotherapy, manual therapy, pain management, FCAMPT, Physioactif, Dr. Ariel Desjardins-Charbonneau
image.caption: Dr. Ariel Desjardins-Charbonneau - Your Trusted Physiotherapist

memberOf.name: Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec (OPPQ)
memberOf.description: The Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec (OPPQ) is the regulatory body for physiotherapists in Quebec. Membership in the OPPQ ensures that physiotherapists meet high standards of professional practice and ethics.

memberOf.name: Canadian Physiotherapy Association (ACP)
memberOf.description: The Canadian Physiotherapy Association is a national organization that represents physiotherapists across Canada. Membership provides access to professional development resources and supports advocacy for the profession.

memberOf.name: Canadian Academy of Manipulative Physiotherapy (CAMPT)
memberOf.description: The Canadian Academy of Manipulative Physiotherapy is an organization dedicated to advancing manual and manipulative therapy in Canada. As a Fellow of CAMPT, Dr. Desjardins-Charbonneau has demonstrated advanced clinical skills in this area.

awards: Fellow of the Canadian Academy of Manipulative Physiotherapy (FCAMPT), 2017

hasOccupation.qualifications: Licensed physiotherapist in Quebec, FCAMPT certification
hasOccupation.responsibilities: Assess, diagnose, and treat physical dysfunction, injury, and pain using therapeutic exercise, manual therapy, and other interventions.

hasOccupation.name: Lecturer at Université de Montréal

hasOccupation.qualifications: Licensed physiotherapist in Quebec, expertise in physiotherapy research and education

hasOccupation.name: Teacher at Physiolab School

hasOccupation.responsibilities: Teach advanced physiotherapy techniques, mentor practicing physiotherapists, develop curriculum for continuing education courses
